title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
sdumitriu - (00:00): lucaa: There are two kinds of document saves  
sdumitriu - (00:00): Normally, when you add/remove an annotation from the UI, there's a document "update" event and a "addAnnotation" event  
sdumitriu - (00:00): This is normal  
sdumitriu - (00:01): Then, when saving a document that has annotations, there's an extra "update" event, which is a bit ugly  
lucaa - (00:01): yes, I understand, but I don;t know how to fix it  
lucaa - (00:01): except with prenotifications  
lucaa - (00:01): and even then, I need a bit of refactor in the annotations  
sdumitriu - (00:01): Use xcontext  
sdumitriu - (00:02): (hack, hack, hack!)  
lucaa - (00:02): xcontext?  
sdumitriu - (00:03): XWikiContext#put("someMarkerToSkipNotifications")  
lucaa - (00:05): and modify XWiki.java to skip if that variable is set?  
lucaa - (00:05): because I am still doing a saveDocument  
sdumitriu - (00:05): Yes  
lucaa - (00:05): but that's really ugly  
lucaa - (00:05): and I cannot decide on that by myself  
sdumitriu - (00:05): The alternative is to add yet another saveDocument method with a boolean skipNotifications  
lucaa - (00:06): which is not such a bad thing, is it  
lucaa - (00:06): ?  
lucaa - (00:06): I mean, it feels to me like normal api  
sdumitriu - (00:06): Not as bad as the marker thing  
sdumitriu - (00:06): But it's not nice, since there are already 3 methods  
lucaa - (00:08): it feels to me that it's kinda normal to have a method that saves without notifying... although we need to think if it's good to expose it, i mean if callers can't abuse it  
sdumitriu - (00:08): jvelociter: {{html}}<tt> => #${escapetool.H}  
jvelociter - (00:11): ah right did not though of that  
sdumitriu - (00:11): cjdelisle suggested it last night  
vmassol left at 00:15 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa - (00:18): sdumitriu: where do I see the new activity stream thing to test the annotations events?  
lucaa - (00:18): is it in the last snap? (from here http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/2.6-SNAPSHOT/ )  
lucaa - (00:19): I just installed it and I have nothing changed on the main page  
sdumitriu - (00:20): The plugin only  
sdumitriu - (00:20): The UI is comming soon  
sdumitriu - (00:21): You can use this to list events:  
sdumitriu - (00:22): {{velocity}}  
sdumitriu - (00:22): #foreach($event in $xwiki.activitystream.getEvents(false, 20, 0))  
sdumitriu - (00:22):   \* $event.type on $event.date by $event.user  
sdumitriu - (00:22): #end  
sdumitriu - (00:22): {{/velocity}}  
lucaa - (00:23): thanks a lot  
cjdelisle - (00:25): try http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/2.6-SNAPSHOT/  
cjdelisle - (00:25): com/xpn/xwiki/products  is now org/xwiki/enterprise  
lucaa - (00:26): right, this explains some things  
lucaa - (00:26): since when?  
lucaa - (00:26): in any case, i have a local now  
lucaa - (00:26): but smth is not really right  
cjdelisle - (00:26): vmassol sent mail about it.  
lucaa - (00:27): because in the com.x.x. folder the zip.md5 and sha1  are still updated today  
lucaa - (00:27): as opposed to the zip which is not  
lucaa - (00:28): (thanks for the update, cjdelisle )  
jvelociter left at 00:28 (Quit: jvelociter  
cjdelisle - (00:29): vmassol and I had this exact same conversation last night, evalica had the same problem.  
cjdelisle - (00:29): He thinks it's nexus updating the .md5 and .sha1 files.  
lucaa - (00:29): ok  
rrodriguez - (00:32): sdumitriu: could you check, please?  
rrodriguez - (00:33): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/AdminGuide/Configuration/XWikiExport201010272351.png  
sdumitriu - (00:34): rrodriguez: Looks good  
rrodriguez - (00:35): K I'll edit the document. I think a new layout is needed to better show the relations  
rrodriguez - (00:35): I'll think about this.

Stulle - (09:41): sdumitriu: hey  
Stulle - (09:42): i saw your fix on the colibri and it does indeed work for vertical align  
Stulle - (09:42): \*colibri skin  
Stulle - (09:43): however, it does not work on text-align... so trying to use (% text-align: right %) in front of a table has no effect, while using (% vertical-align: bottom %) does  
Stulle - (09:45): and trying to use (% class="MyStyleExtensionClass" %) before a table does not work either  
Stulle - (09:48): and using vertical align on cells with multiple lines in ((( ))) groups is not working either

vmassol - (10:07): evalica: good morning  
vmassol - (10:08): evalica: I don't know if you have some time at the moment or not. If you have I'd need your help on designing a new XWiki Syntax page that look appealing and that can scale for multiple syntaxes.  
vmassol - (10:09): (since we need to start documenting the XWiki Syntax 2.1 and the current page is so ugly…. ;))  
evalica - (10:10): vmassol:  morning - right now I'm kind of busy - until when you need it? can I start on monday?  
vmassol - (10:10): evalica: sure there's no hurry

vmassol - (11:16): guys check this out: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Supporters  
vmassol - (11:16): (bottom of page)  
vmassol - (11:16): this is nice, isn't it?  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 11:20  
rrodriguez - (11:24): vmassol: cool!  
evalica - (11:24): the twitter thing? :) yea  
lucaa - (11:25): yes, the only drawback is that it loads empty, it should load last 10 or something  
sburjan - (11:26): vmassol: cool. is that a macro we have ? :)  
vmassol - (11:31): sburjan: nope just found it on the izpack web site and copied it  
vmassol - (11:31): sburjan: would be easy to make a macro of it  
vmassol - (11:31): (a wiki macro)  
sburjan - (11:32): yeah, and it looks pretty nice  
mflorea left at 11:36 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:38  
vmassol - (11:46): guys, I'm doing a refactoring to move the macro transformation and all associated classes (ie all macro related classes) into a xwiki-rendering-transformation-macro module  
vmassol - (11:46): this is logical IMO since the macro notion is not a core notion of the rendering api  
vmassol - (11:46): it's an extension brought by the macro extension  
vmassol - (11:47): if you have any doubt about this let me know  
sdumitriu - (11:48): +1  
vmassol - (11:48): s/macro extension/macro transformation/  
vmassol - (11:49): it also allws people to use the rendering engine without macros  
vmassol - (11:49): (for standalone usage)

rrodriguez - (12:32): vmassol: ping  
vmassol - (12:34): rrodriguez: pong  
vmassol - (12:34): is the issue implemented already?  
vmassol - (12:34): XWIKI-5633  
vmassol - (12:35): sdumitriu: re rights checks, it should be done at the Script services level IMO  
vmassol - (12:35): in the xwiki scripts module  
vmassol - (12:35): I had sent some quick proposal on how to do this  
vmassol - (12:35): (on the list)  
rrodriguez - (12:35): vmassol: I've uploaded a new chart and was trying to get feedback. Perhaps a Jira Issue is not the right place. Just trying to avoid to bother people here and get the work documented!  
vmassol - (12:36): rrodriguez: if you have uploaded it then it's already done!  
vmassol - (12:36): if you wanted to ask for feedabck then it shouldn't be put at the target location  
vmassol - (12:36): it's too late  
rrodriguez - (12:36): ok  
vmassol - (12:36): but I thought this was discussed already with sergiu yesterday night?  
vmassol - (12:36): apparenrtly I'm missing something  
vmassol - (12:36): I don't understand why you want feedback or a jira issue  
vmassol - (12:37): (after it's already done)  
rrodriguez - (12:37): nope, you are not missing anything.  
rrodriguez - (12:37): it is simple: my fault  
vmassol - (12:37): ok then I'll close the issue as done  
rrodriguez - (12:37): ok, thanks  
vmassol - (12:37): (no point in deleting ità  
vmassol - (12:37): it)  
sdumitriu - (12:39): rrodriguez: The new image looks great  
vmassol - (12:39): rrodriguez: thanks for doing it  
rrodriguez - (12:39): sdumitriu: please, could you check this new release? I've slightly changed the layout  
rrodriguez - (12:39): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/AdminGuide/Configuration/XWikiExport201010281008.png  
sdumitriu - (12:39): It's not as crowded as the old one  
rrodriguez - (12:39): thanks to both  
rrodriguez - (12:40): I miss an explanation about where pdf.css and pdf.vm are located, if at any place!  
rrodriguez - (12:41): do you think it is worth to include it?  
sdumitriu - (12:43): pdf.vm is in /templates/, as any other velocity template  
sdumitriu - (12:43): pdf.css does not exist by default  
sdumitriu - (12:43): It should be created in a skin or in templates  
rrodriguez - (12:45): K; i don't know why I didn't find pdf.vm yesterday; I'll add this to the chart. Thanks  
lucaa - (12:51): guys, how can I skip one class from clirr check? can I do that?  
lucaa - (12:54): ok, I got it  
lucaa - (12:55): I was writing it wrong in the exclude...  
lucaa - (12:55): it's a very strange notation... (/ for package separator but no extension at the end, like a class not a file)  
lucaa - (13:33): ok, sdumitriu I fixed the annotations notifications but now it seems it takes forever to save a document with annotations in it  
lucaa - (13:33): ...  
lucaa - (13:33): is event firing slow?  
sdumitriu - (13:33): Endelss Loop?  
lucaa - (13:33): taking time?  
lucaa - (13:33): I don't know  
sdumitriu - (13:34): No, it should be very fast  
lucaa - (13:34): console doesn't say anything  
sdumitriu - (13:34): As fast as before  
lucaa - (13:34): I need to investigate and I don't have time right now :(  
lucaa - (13:34): I mean I don't have a lot of time  
lucaa - (13:34): if you want, I can commit and you look at it  
lucaa - (13:35): it's not complete anyway, some extra checks need to be done to improve notifications firing  
lucaa - (13:35): and also the save document skip notifications needs to be fixed  
lucaa - (13:38): anyone knows where do I find the logs in jetty?  
rrodriguez - (13:48): lucaa: /var/log/jetty6 ?  
lucaa - (13:48): I mean the standalone xwiki distro  
rrodriguez - (13:49): i don't know  
rrodriguez - (13:53): sdumitriu: please, could you check this http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/AdminGuide/Configuration/XWikiExport201010281339.png? I'll stop doing modifications. Just put Velocity out of the "flow" as the other processors and split the note about the URI and XWiki.PDFClass properties. For me, is clearer now. Thanks.  
sdumitriu - (13:55): rrodriguez: Make the "Processors" box pink as well, to match the processor tools boxes  
rrodriguez - (13:55): K  
sdumitriu - (13:57): Velocity: remove "and core tools"  
sdumitriu - (13:58): Hm, actually it's not quite correct  
sdumitriu - (13:58): Since now it looks like Velocity processes the "rendered pdf.vm"  
rrodriguez - (13:59): This is confusing for me as well  
sdumitriu - (13:59): OK, replace "ExportAction renders /templates/pdf.vm" with "pdf.vm template"  
rrodriguez - (14:00): OK, for me the problem was to include the verb  
sdumitriu - (14:00): Hm, or to make it consistent with the .xsl files:  
sdumitriu - (14:01): pdf.vm  
sdumitriu - (14:01): (by default in templates/)  
rrodriguez - (14:01): and the css  
rrodriguez - (14:01): perhaps better only pdf.vm\* and to add a note the same way is has been done with pdf.css?  
sdumitriu - (14:02): Yep  
rrodriguez - (14:03): K. I'll do it  
sdumitriu - (14:03): Note that pdf.vm can also be placed in a skin  
rrodriguez - (14:03): OK

Stulle - (14:21): XSCOLIBRI-239

Stulle - (14:38): ok  
Stulle - (14:38): :)

rrodriguez - (14:41): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/AdminGuide/Configuration/XWikiExport201010281437.png

jvelociter - (14:43): guys, when is 2.5.1 planned /  
jvelociter - (14:43): ?  
sdumitriu - (14:43): rrodriguez: Yes, OK to remove it  
jvelociter - (14:43): (if it is)  
sdumitriu - (14:43): It should be obvious  
sdumitriu - (14:43): jvelociter: No plan so far  
sdumitriu - (14:43): When we have enough critical bugs fixes  
jvelociter - (14:43): ok  
sdumitriu - (14:43): Do you think it's time?  
sdumitriu - (14:44): By the way, vmassol, who is going to be the release manager for 2.6?  
rrodriguez - (14:46): Done. I'll update the document if the chart is OK now.  
vmassol - (14:46): sdumitriu: not fully decided yet I think. I said I could do it. That said I'm off next monday so I won't be avail before tuesday  
vmassol - (14:46): (for 2.6RC1)  
vmassol - (14:47): I'm also off tomorrow  
vmassol - (14:47): so I could do it if we postpone by 2-3 days which isn't good  
vmassol - (14:48): (tomorrow wasn't planned: some good friend died and I'm attending the funerals)  
sdumitriu - (14:48): rrodriguez: "it could also be in a skin" => "it can be overwritten in a skin"  
rrodriguez - (14:49): K  
sdumitriu - (14:50): rrodriguez: After that, I'd say it's nice enough to be published  
vmassol - (14:51): published?  
vmassol - (14:51): isn't it already published? :)  
sdumitriu - (14:51): No, it's just attached, but not used in the content  
sdumitriu - (14:51): Is it?  
rrodriguez - (14:51): concerning pdf.css, does a copy in a skin overwrite the copy in /template?  
vmassol - (14:51): well I'm sure it is used  
vmassol - (14:52): (maybe not the latest version but it's been changed compared to before)  
sdumitriu - (14:52): rrodriguez: Yes  
vmassol - (14:52): anyway it's ok  
rrodriguez - (14:52): K  
rrodriguez - (14:52): I'll send a new update before "publishing" it  
vmassol - (14:53): rrodriguez: mayb clean all the different versions when you're done  
vmassol - (14:53): I see a lot of attachments  
rrodriguez - (14:53): yes  
vmassol - (14:53): and we could use the xwiki's attachment versioning feature  
rrodriguez - (14:53): I'll do that  
rrodriguez - (14:55): concerning XWiki versioning feature, it is cool to keep versioning of, for instance in this case, image files; but I don't now how to use it fluently to keep intermediate stages of the graffle document.  
rrodriguez - (14:55): I'll try to explain this better later on...  
sdumitriu - (14:56): rrodriguez: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewattachrev/AdminGuide/Configuration/XWikiExport201010281339.png  
sdumitriu - (14:56): Just attach it using the same name  
rrodriguez - (14:56): yes, yes, no problema about this! we are extensively using this nice feature here  
sdumitriu - (14:56): Each time you upload it, you'll create a new version, keeping all the older ones in the history  
rrodriguez - (14:57): yes, but dealing with, let's call them, work files, a LyX document, a OmniGraffle document,...  
arkub left at 14:58 (Quit: Leaving  
rrodriguez - (14:58): some times we do prefer to generate and store an intermediate version...  
rrodriguez - (14:58): I think I'm needing WedDAV accesss to XWiki, that's all  
rrodriguez - (14:59): but I've had no time to try it yet  
arkub joined #xwiki at 14:59  
sdumitriu - (14:59): Yep, WebDAV for attachments works great  
sdumitriu - (15:00): Each time you save the file, it creates a new version  
rrodriguez - (15:01): That's it!  
rrodriguez - (15:01): I've to test this here asap  
rrodriguez - (15:06): sdumitriu: let's see if this could be OK. I'm not very much convinced with the paragraph about pdf.vm and pdf.css  
sdumitriu - (15:09): rrodriguez: Perfect  
rrodriguez - (15:09): thanks; I'll modify the document now and clean the attachments later  
sdumitriu - (15:10): K  
sdumitriu - (15:10): Thanks for the help, rrodriguez  
sdumitriu - (15:10): And thanks for helping on the mailing list  
sdumitriu - (15:10): That's how communities work, you get some, you give some  
rrodriguez - (15:10): sdumutriu, all: thanks to all of you for your hard work  
vmassol - (15:13): (btw this shows we need a gliffy integration with xwiki)  
rrodriguez - (15:14): vmassol: please, what do you mean?  
Stulle - (15:14): just a thought, it would be nice if the text below the graph was actually text that can be made searchable  
Stulle - (15:15): it might make the look somewhat less nice, granted, but i think it'd still be preferable from a users point of view  
rrodriguez - (15:15): I do agree with this  
rrodriguez - (15:15): absolutely  
Stulle - (15:15): :)  
rrodriguez - (15:15): If is not searchable, it doesn't exist  
rrodriguez - (15:15): :)  
vmassol - (15:16): rrodriguez: http://www.gliffy.com/  
vmassol - (15:16): (to edit diagrams in the wiki and not need desktop tools)  
rrodriguez - (15:16): cool!  
rrodriguez - (15:16): cool, cool!  
Stulle - (15:16): yep, about my point. someone might want to use the search to research on this and if he does not use the correct words but some that are only mentioned in the picture he's prolly not gonna find it  
vmassol - (15:17): rrodriguez: same as we have the balsamiq mockup integration  
rrodriguez - (15:17): diagrams are one of the main languages used here  
rrodriguez - (15:17): time ago I took a look at that. I'll regain access to this thread as well!  
rrodriguez - (15:18): so: I'll clean attachments, I'll make this text searchable... and keep trying my understanding about this great environment! :-)  
rrodriguez - (15:18): Thanks!  
Stulle - (15:20): nice!  
Stulle - (15:22): about gliffy, it looks nice but i wonder if it'd actually benefit an open source wiki software to make use of high pricing proprietary tools to increase usability  
rrodriguez - (15:23): Stulle: it is by no means easy to find the right equilibrium between commercial soffware and open source software  
rrodriguez - (15:23): even more: i think it is an art!  
rrodriguez - (15:24): but, for me, it is a requirement  
Stulle - (15:24): i know... doing my own private development (open source) with MS Visual Studio ;)  
Stulle - (15:24): but to extend it i'd rather not make use of payed add-ons  
vmassol - (15:25): Stulle: if you know of an oss tool that is good for this please let us know!  
vmassol - (15:25): it's not about oss vs non oss, it's about the best tools for the job  
vmassol - (15:25): look we're using jira for example at jira.xwiki.org  
vmassol - (15:25): it's not oss  
Stulle - (15:25): anyway, i figure not all companies are like this particular department i work for and they'd actually make a lot more use of diagrams  
vmassol - (15:25): I'm using a mac tool  
vmassol - (15:25): s/tool/too/  
vmassol - (15:25): with OSX  
Stulle - (15:25): right, this is no criticism  
vmassol - (15:25): not oss  
vmassol - (15:25): :)  
Stulle - (15:25): don't get me wrong  
vmassol - (15:25): but I agree with you  
vmassol - (15:25): if the best tool is oss we shoudl use it ;)  
vmassol - (15:26): (even if it's not best but close)  
Stulle - (15:26): personally, i can live with a quirk or two if it's for free  
rrodriguez - (15:26): that's the point: XWiki is the best tool, you should is it! :-)  
Stulle - (15:26): and usually community support is somewhat more direct, imo  
Stulle - (15:27): but i think many companies are not willing to be this direct... they just want somebody to work it for them or have it working without any ado all together  
vmassol - (15:28): Stulle: sure but that's not a difference of oss vs non oss, oss can work OOB too  
Stulle - (15:29): you're loosing me in all those abbriviations! ;) anyway, i think i got the ghist, yeah, open source can be very professional but it needs professional companies to support it to be acceptable for companies who want to make use of it  
Stulle - (15:29): that's at least the experience i gather in the company i work for right now  
vmassol - (15:29): OOB = out of the box  
Stulle - (15:29): still only an internship, though  
Stulle - (15:30): ahhh  
vmassol - (15:30): yes companies help but it's also about maturity of a project too  
Stulle - (15:30): definately

cjdelisle - (15:58): Sent an attempt at answering the question about the future of storage.  
cjdelisle - (15:59): Call me a cynic but I don't think hibernate+sql is going anywhere any time soon.  
cjdelisle - (16:00): Hard enough to convince people to stop using mysql+myisam  
vmassol - (16:00): cjdelisle: we shouldn't care ideally  
vmassol - (16:00): if we hide this behind our own storage interface  
cjdelisle - (16:01): The trouble is we don't.  
cjdelisle - (16:01): xwiki.searchDocuments will break spectacularly.  
cjdelisle - (16:01): But the query module will start acting strangely as well (I predict)  
cjdelisle - (16:02): this is based on the fact that I can sneak raw hibernate queries into the query module and get them to work.  
cjdelisle - (16:03): thus a jcr implementation of the query module will probably break some queries and not others.
